metadata.title: CVE-2019-10208 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was discovered in postgresql versions 9.4.x before 9.4.24, 9.5.xbefore 9.5.19, 9.6.x before 9.6.15, 10.x before 10.10 and 11.x before 11.5where arbitrary SQL statements can be executed given a suitable SECURITYDEFINER function. An attacker, with EXECUTE permission on the function, canexecute arbitrary SQL as the owner of the function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10208` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 10.10-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libecpg6 - 10.10-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 10.10-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpq5 - 10.10-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-10 - 10.10-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-client-10 - 10.10-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plperl-10 - 10.10-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plpython-10 - 10.10-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-10 - 10.10-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-10 - 10.10-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-10 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.10-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
